thread.title: Ed Sheeran hints at wedding bells after saying he feels "pretty good" about future marriage to girlfriend Cherry Seaborn
thread.title_full: Ed Sheeran hints at wedding bells after saying he feels "pretty good" about future marriage to girlfriend Cherry Seaborn

author: Alistair McGeorge
title: Ed Sheeran hints at wedding bells after saying he feels "pretty good" about future marriage to girlfriend Cherry Seaborn
text:
Showbiz Ed Sheeran hints at wedding bells after saying he feels "pretty good" about future marriage to girlfriend Cherry Seaborn Ed has been dating former school friend Cherry since 2015 but they largely keep romance out of spotlight Share Ed Sheeran and girlfriend Cherry Seaborn (Photo: Copyright unknown) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Ed Sheeran has hinted there could be wedding bells in his future after saying he feels “pretty good” about the possibility of marrying girlfriend Cherry Seaborn. 
The ‘Shape Of You’ singer, 25, is notoriously private about his personal life and rarely speaks out about other half Cherry, who prefers to stay away from the limelight. 
But during an interview with Australian radio’s Kyle and Jackie O show, the award-winning popstar said things with Cherry are going real well. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now 'Mini Ed Sheeran' misses out on his idols tour tickets Share this video Watch Next 
Asked if the match had the potential for “marriage”, he replied: “I’m pretty… yeah, I feel pretty good about it.” 
He also said he’d “love” to have a family with Cherry. 
“Potentially, I would like some kids,” he said. 
The singer has been in a relationship with his former school friend Cherry since the middle of 2015, and the pair spent most of 2016 travelling the world together as Ed enjoyed a year off from the music business. 
The Castle on the Hill star couldn't be happier with the pretty hockey player and he knew he had fallen hard for Cherry when he agreed to add some feline friends to their home. 
Speaking on BBC Radio 2, he shared: "I'm actually the happiest I've been and it's because I had a year to spend with someone. I've always started relationships then gone off on tour. He has penned a song for his lover (Photo: 2014 Getty Images) 
"I spent every day for a year with this certain person, we kind of have a strong relationship now which is good. 
"I'm really secure now, we live together and we have cats, and I think when you have cats that's kind of it." 
Ed has penned the song Perfect for his lover on his upcoming third album Divide but he chickened out of playing it in front of her and instead sent her the intimate track via email. 
The musician said: "I just recorded it and sent it because she was living in New York at the time so I didn't see her reaction. I think she liked it, it's a gooden." 
Ed will be heading back out on the road later this year in support of his new LP but he isn't worried about his touring schedule putting any pressure on his relationship. 
He explained: "The road is not going to be as intense anymore, it's not like I'm doing theatres every day, I have lots of days off and it's mostly around Europe for the first half of the year, it's gonna be fun." Like us on Facebook
